Reviews.Title: Amazing zoom
Reviews.Author: Mike Jay
Reviews.Content: (update on bottom)First up, I actually own the DMC-SZ02 which is available at a certain store in my area founded by Sam Walton... :) I am 99.9% certain this is the exact same camera as the DMC-SZ1, please correct me if I`m wrong. But dont confuse either of these with the DMC-ZS1 (note the ZS and SZ difference), which is also available but quite different. Cant they get a little more creative with the product names?I`ve owned and tried out many "pocket" cameras over the years. I`ve usually ended up with Casio Exilims, even though I have tried out Canon Elphs (just cant get myself to like the tiny Elph), Nikons (good features but poor pic quality), a Samsung (terrible) and even one other Lumix (can't remember why I didn't keep it) in the past. This Lumix is by far my favorite.Granted that you must understand what you are getting with a pocket camera. They will not be top quality photos with everything intended to be framed as art. But they are more than fine for capturing many (I have thousands of) memories to be stored on the hard drive and you do get an occasional really nice bonus picture to print as an 8x10. The good thing is that you actually have it WITH you (I carry it in a smartphone leather holster, fits perfect) so that a semi-quality picture is better than NO pic because you didn't want to drag around a full size camera.OK having said that, this camera is very impressive. The zoom especially stands out. I never imagined the zoom on a pocket camera could ever be improved this much. I found myself saying "Wow" many times after taking some test shots. Even the digital zoom turns out to be useful, when it fails miserably and is a joke on every other camera I`ve tried it on. Other digital zooms are better described as "the distorted pixelation button", so I have no idea what voodoo magic they invoked to make their digital zoom actually look decent in most cases.The overall quality is excellent for it's class as well, with the exception of some indoor settings which EVERY camera in this class struggles with, so don't be fooled by ANY brand's marketing hype including Panasonic's "Intelligent Auto" (although it does work for other purposes as intended). But if I play with manual settings, I can eventually get a good indoor picture, usually by turning flash OFF, which is counter intuitive for the novice.It is easy to hold onto with a very thoughtful textured thumb area, whereas many cameras this size pack every inch with buttons. It's my perfect size, small enough to stow out of the way, but not so tiny I struggle to hold it like the Elph I dropped and broke the lens on the first day two Christmas' ago.I`ll admit the body feels a little "plastic-y" but I cant comment on durability yet, I`ve only had it a week. I`ve always had the impression Panasonic makes a durable product, but only time will tell. My Exilims had all metal bodies and let me tell you they take a licking... and a dropping ... and keep on ticking. That is one area they excel.Lumix isn't known for it's innovative software or menus, so they are pretty basic and not worth special mention. Although in normal a.k.a. manual shooting mode, there are many settings that can be tweaked. I think with Lumix you are paying for the lens and sensor quality, not frivolous things like a touchscreen. My only wish is that they would add useful scene modes like "children playing indoors" and "outdoor sports" rather than "food" and "baby". Seriously?I can highly recommend this camera for what it is. Good luck finding other reviews as of this writing! Pretty much non existent, so I hope mine helps. (edit: now with over 200 reviews on Amazon alone, this statement is obviously outdated!)---Update! 11/2/2013It's been about a year and a half since we bought this. We have likely taken over 1,000 pics and movies with it. It looks practically brand new and still takes wonderful pictures, yet again with the disclaimer: "for the size and price". It has been a great asset to us and have no regrets buying it. I still absolutely love the fact it can optical zoom while taking movies! At least at the time we bought it, that feature was almost unheard of. I have not researched newer cameras lately because we simply don't need one as long as this lasts. The only single fault I can find is that the battery life may be less than when it was new (to be expected). However it's not enough to bother us yet and if it gets to that point, a new battery is under 10 bucks. Sometimes I look for any excuse to upgrade my electronics to today's "new & improved", but I would not hesitate to buy another battery and hope this camera lasts well into the future.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Alanwagen "alanwagen"
Reviews.Content: Let me qualify this and let me say that I don't know if this is this best camera, just an opinion.First things first, in a basic sense of what you buy a camera for is to take sharp pictures.  That it does so I am pleased.Now the perks which are sort of neato mosquito:  It does self stitching panoramic photos with out software, you change mode and hold the shutter button down and pan and it stitches away. This includes side to side as well as up and down like you would need for a tall building.Another mode will decorate your picture with a frame, my favorite is the heart frame.  It does baby scenes where you can have text of the name of the baby and his or her age in months and days.  It automatically figures this out from the birth date.All told there are 15 scenes.Another feature which may come in handy is that it uses the new SDXC memory cards, a very high capacity card like 64 gig or 128 gig.  So if are going to shoot a lot of video, you will be set.  It records in the MP4 format.  It has a separate shutter button for movies so you can shoot on the fly and not have to change modes.  Who needs a separate video camera? It does let you zoom while shooting video.You can also set the viewfinder screen to bright for when you are outside.Summary:  A great little handy, capable, and excellent camera. My wife has the Lumix DMC-FH25 Panasonic DMC-FH25K 16.1MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black) which if also a good camera (see reviews) but I like mine better.BTW It will use after market batteries if price is a concern. Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Panasonic DMW-BCK7, DMW-BCK7E, DMW-BCK7PP, NCA-YN101F, NCA-YN101G, NCA-YN101H, DE-A91B, DE-A92A, DE-A92B, Lumix DMC-FH2, DMC-FH4, DMC-FH5, DMC-FH6, DMC-FH7, DMC-FH8, DMC-FH25, DMC-FH27, DMC-FP5, DMC-FP7, DMC-FS16...Oct 12, 2012UPDATE:  Bad news, my screen broke.  Must be fragile as I did not drop my camera. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point and Shoot - With a Great Zoom Too!
Reviews.Author: coffee lover
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and so far I am very impressed - normally I don't write reviews until I have had something a little bit longer but with so few reviews anywhere on the internet...... When you first open the Amazon box you are struck with how tiny the box it comes in is- and then you open the box for the camera! The thing is definitely pocket-sized but not flimsy! The metal body feels very sturdy and very well made. The pictures that it takes with any of the settings are all fantastic - with or without the zoom. The intelligent auto (iA) mode does a great job discerning what is required of the shot. I am also very impressed with the 10x zoom and the 20x digital zoom. It is however lacking in that you cannot choose a lot of the "scene" features, they are chosen for you in iA, if you are looking for a point and shoot that you have the ability to control more- look at something more along the lines of my other camera- Canon PowerShot SX200IS. Overall I think it is going to be a great camera that I can put in my back pocket, not worry about taking to Disney World but yet get some amazing pictures by just pushing a button - all for less than $200.

Reviews.Title: Images like the ZS20 at half the cost.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: The more expensive (and powerful) ZS20 is currently the best-selling point and shoot on Amazon, but most shooters will achieve equally satisfying images from the equally high-rated (and recommended by Consumer Reports), smaller and less expensive Panasonic SZ1, while enjoying longer battery life (the touch-controls of the ZS20 take a significant toll).  As for other Panasonic choices, the prices of the DMC-FH25/27 and the newer (by one year) DMC-SZ1 are practically identical, but the SZ1 has a wider-angle lens (25mm vs 28mm), a longer telephoto lens (10X optical/20X digital vs. 8X zoom; ), and is even lighter (5oz. vs. 6oz).  Moreover, "Consumer Reports," in rating the SZ1 above the DMC-FH27, gives the advantage to the SZ1 in the following areas: improved image stabilization; better audio quality (mono) during video use; dramatically faster start-up time (almost instant with the SZ1); a brighter and larger LCD screen (3" vs. 2.7" for the FM25 and 2.9" for FH27's touch-screen).Panasonic Lumix SZ1 vs. Panasonic SZ7:The SZ7 was released within days of the SZ1, and the price differential between the two cameras is less than expected (currently approx. $40).  Dimensions and weight are virtually identical. The SZ7 offers 1080p HD movie mode; the SZ1 has 720p HD (a noticeable difference only if you plan on showing movies on a 50" screen or larger).  The SZ7 has a stereo microphone; the SZ1 has a monaural mic (an imperceptible difference when separation is this minimal).  The SZ7 advertises speeds of up to 10 sharp images per second at full resolution; the SZ1 is less than two images per sec (but at 2 megapixels sharper than the SZ7).  What isn't clarified is that the SZ1 also permits speeds of 10 images per second but at a resolution of 3mp instead of 16. (My first 2 digital cameras--a Sony and a Canon--both featured lenses that were under 3 mp.  They both delivered exceptionally sharp photos--especially when not enlarged above 5X7).Panasonic vs. Canon.1. Size and shots.  The SZ1 is a "subcompact" but not as "little" as the Canon Elf series.  The SZ1 boasts a sleek and slim body on the outside, mirroring its new, state-of-the-art Leica Lens System on the inside. The images are as good as those I get from my Canon SD780 (costing 3 times more).  The SD780 has a body that's almost 25% smaller (despite including a viewfinder!) than the SZ1 (which does not have a viewfinder). But there are downsides to extreme miniaturization.  The SZ1 is easier to grip, and its image stabilization appears to be superior (even my wife gets uncharacteristically sharp and steady photos).2. Ease of operation. The Canon has one external setting that's totally automatic, leaving nothing for its owner to do but depress the shutter button.  The Panasonic requires a couple of extra moves, which will be intuitive to experienced photographers: Press the "Mode" button; then, of the 4 choices, select "Intelligent Auto" for total automation, including zoom capabilities of 20:1 (the SD780 is 4:1).  For maximum Manual control, select "Scenic Mode" from the four options.3. Display. The Panasonic's display is the best I've seen on a point and shoot--perfect for a slide show (with special effects) shortly after taking the pictures (here's where the tiny Canon is clearly overmatched.4. Battery and charging.  The Canon requires constant and careful removal of the battery for recharging in a dedicated charger that's never there when needed.  By contrast, the Panasonic runs away with honors: you charge the battery while it remains in the camera (a light on the camera illuminates until the battery is fully charged). An AC cord or USB cable will do the job--take your pick.Camera sales have slowed down since the development of competitive cameras on multi-purpose devices like the iPhone (which has spurred the point 'n shoot makers to come to market with increasingly stylish, user-friendly, technically superior cameras).  As a result, distributors are slow to "hype" new cameras before last year's glut has cleared warehouse shelves.  But be prepared to see the SZ1 climbing in the ranks of the most popular such cameras (especially at this price).  In my book, the SZ1 is #1 among all cameras costing less than $150.  [I plan to revisit the page, should Amazon offer another lot of these full-featured subcompacts at $94.]Later:  [This undeniable value has finally cracked the top 100 of the most popular point 'n shoot cameras in Amazon's ratings. Formerly it was way down in the ratings whereas its predecessor, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH25/FH27, was listed among the top five.  The DZ1 has an exceptional 10:1 optical lens, and if the digital extension is factored in, the camera can be compared with the far pricier Panasonic ZS20, which has a 20:1 optical lens.  Several days ago, the SZ1 was available from Amazon Prime for $94 (in smaller print on the right side of the page).  Now that I've used the camera, I wish I had ordered an additional SZ1 at that price.  It's still the best lens I've seen for $120.  The on-line ratings by Consumer Reports place this Panasonic among the top 7 cameras (out of approx. 50)--just behind the Canon S95 and Elph 310.  None of its rivals can compare with its 10:1 optical lens.]

Reviews.Title: Some notes that do not appear elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Helvetiaphile
Reviews.Content: There's no reason for me to write another thorough review, so I'll just list a few items that do not appear in the other reviews.I always download the operating guide for a camera I am considering, and read it cover to cover. This tells you what the "gotchas" are. When I went to Panasonic's support pages I discovered that this camera does not exist. I was unable to find a copy of the manual on the WWW except at those sites that offer free downloads in exchange for infecting your computer. When I received the camera I noted that one manual was printed for the SZ1, SZ02 (yes it's the same) and the similarly operating but entirely differently constructed FH8. I did a web search for support for this model and finally found the online manual at [...] . You will get the operating guide on a CD but it has security, while the online version has no security. You probably don't care but I like to edit the manuals, eliminating the warnings about burning down my house, and features that apply only to other cameras in the series. The edited PDF will go on my Kindle and on my vacation.The supplied firmware as of Sept. 1, 2012 (or 8 months after release) is still current and is version 1.0. At least there's no firmware update on the Panasonic support website.Speaking of vacations, I bought the SZ1 as a travel camera. I always buy two extra generic batteries and have previously used a standalone charger, and Panasonic makes terrific ones (though none is included with this camera). The best one for this camera is the DE-A91 with folding plug, not the DE-A92. It (or a convincing counterfeit) can be had on ebay for $15. I've also used the generic ones for $10, but they are much larger. When I saw the included charger and noted that it is microscopic, I decided that for this camera I would take along the included charger, which utilizes the USB cable to connect to the camera, and forego the standalone charger.I particularly like that this camera still takes SD/SDHC/SDXC cards rather than those hateful micro SD cards, as some of the Samsungs do. The full-size cards are cheaper, have more capacity and speed and are a little harder to counterfeit, since there is more area on which to print identifying information. I've bought a LOT of flash cards and would say that 90% are counterfeits, including virtually all sold in 'bulk' (absent) packaging. Apparently less expertise is needed to counterfeit the card than the packaging, so just pay a little extra for a packaged card. I'm also a believer in not putting all your eggs in one basket. Consider taking two flash cards on your trip and swapping them every day or two. If one goes bad you'll still have a good selection of photos.The LCD is 3" but the plastic covering it is 3.2". I suggest buying a 99-cent 3" screen protector. If you buy one too big, such as 3.5", it is difficult to neatly cut them down. They peel right off so if yours becomes nasty you can replace it.There is no setting for COMPRESSION. Typically there is a Fine and a SuperFine setting, but now that flash cards are so cheap there's no good reason to use the higher compression 'Fine' setting, so I'm glad they dropped this. A 16mp photo is still going to use only 6mb of space so this is already pretty well degraded. It would be wonderful if they allowed you to record in either RAW or TIF or high-quality JPG. . . .The PANORAMA function is pretty primitive, as it makes only a tiny image. Better to learn how to shoot full-size panoramas and stitch them together in whatever graphics package you have, like Photoshop Elements. The secrets are (1) keep the horizon in the middle of the photo, (2) do NOT use a wide setting like 25mm (I suggest something between 1X and 2X) to avoid vignetting and distortion, (3) overlap a LOT, and (4) do what you can to maintain the same focus and exposure between shots (read manual). If fast-moving clouds are in the photo, or people or cars are passing, you will probably not be successful in producing a good panorama.To connect the camera to the computer in order to download photos, you first plug in the short USB cable. The computer will recognize the connection, but nothing happens. The manual neglects to tell you that you must turn on the camera manually. Then on the LCD you will select 'COMPUTER'. Now you can use either PHOTOfunSTUDIO 8.0 SE (included software, also up-to-date as of 8/1/12) or Windows to upload your photos and videos.As a guy, I like to wear a pocket camera on my belt, and I prefer a case which holds the camera horizontal, making it easier to sit down, so I ordered such a case.I gave the camera ***** even though I might have changed some features.

Reviews.Title: Takes Amazing Pictures!
Reviews.Author: loves2shop
Reviews.Content: I own three digital cameras. A Sony Cyber-shot, a Kodak Easy Share, and now this little jewel and it is by far the best of the three. Don't let it's small size fool you. It takes amazingly clear photos and the zoom is incredible! Most cameras get blurry when you zoom out but not this one. It stays crystal clear.I found this camera to be relatively easy to use and navigate through the features. I started taking and reviewing photos before I even looked at the manual. I love the auto mode as I am no photographer :) The image stabilization works really well. I also love how quickly it takes photos compared to my other two digital cameras. I did a ton of feature and review comparisons on digital cameras on Amazon and came to the conclusion that this one had the best features for the price. I'm so happy with my choice. I can't wait to take it on vacation. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Language teacher in CT
Reviews.Content: Although the price has gone up since I bought this camera, it is still a good value for the money. The anti-shake feature really works! It's hard to hold a small camera steady, but this camera makes up for it.The menu system is intuitive and easy to use. Quality of photos is excellent.I bought it mainly because it's small and fits into a pocket. I don't like to look like a tourist when I travel, so this camera is ideal for travel.

Reviews.Title: All purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Hugh L. Rider
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic Lumix SZ1 16.1 MP Digital Camera w/10X Optical Zoom in Jul 2012 for a great price at $119.00. It fills in where I left out with my 3MP Casio camera...which lost its exposure after 6 years. The one comment is that I wish it had a zoom to view after the picture was taken. I would like to crop. Maybe I have it and haven't found it yet.  This camera has so many functions that I am learning all the time. It has terrific zoom qualities, but make sure your steady at the full zoom before clicking. It is quite unbelievable at this 10X. It focuses quite automatically too...so don't worry.Panasonic Lumix SZ1 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom (Blue)

Reviews.Title: A great little on-the-go camera!
Reviews.Author: A Fan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a family vacation, and right out of the box, I'm very impressed by the customizability of the different menus and settings.  It has settings that optimize the camera for the things you're taking pictures or video of, to include specific settings for pictures of faces, landscapes, looking out through a window, babies, pets, food, and about a dozen others.  The zoom is fantastic and was the main reason I chose this camera over other similarly-priced cameras.  Just testing it out in my hallway, I can stand 20 feet away from my front door and the zoom on the camera can make it look like I'm taking a picture of the doorknob from a foot away.  The optical zoom is, of course, crystal clear, but even the 20x digital zoom looks wonderful compared to many other cameras or cell phone cameras I've used before.  No more grainy, pixellated junk pictures filling up my memory card just because I was trying to capture something far away!I also love how small the thing is.  I bought a carrying case to go with it -- Case Logic ECC-101 Point and Shoot Camera Case (Black) -- and it fit perfectly in the case, and the whole thing (camera in the case) is barely larger than a checkbook!Because I don't just have $100+ dollars to throw away, I consider this to be a "major purchase."  I wanted a camera that I don't expect to be obsolete in just a couple of years, I wanted a camera that could satisfy whatever photography/videography needs I might have during the next 2-3 years at least, and I fully expect to get that and more out of my new camera.  Now, if I were a professional photographer, then I would put in the money for a nice SLR or something much more powerful, but for everyday family uses, I'm very excited that I'll have this little guy by my side.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: dande2169
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is my 2nd Panasonic Lumix (only because I LOVE cameras and felt it was time for an upgrade - my 1st one now belongs to my best friend because it's still an amazing camera) and I really like both cameras so far (really missing my 1st one though).I have 2 issues, so far, with this camera (and the reason it's getting a 4 star instead of a 5 star review). The first issue is that the design isn't all that great. In an effort to make the camera smaller, it seems, the company decided to put the function menu in the actual menu and I prefer  the function menu on the top of the camera. I don't like the function menu location and doubt that I ever will.The second issue I have is with the screen. If you don't hold the camera just right, you don't see the true beauty of the picture - it doesn't matter if you are looking at the picture or showing it to someone else (but it's worse for the people you're trying to show the picture to). That's frustrating because I don't want other people holding my camera due to bad past experiences, but they have a hard time viewing the picture if I am holding the camera - it's like looking at an old plasma screen from an odd angle - all you see is outlines.I would recommend this camera to people, but I would warn them about the two issues I have come across so far and advise them to take those into consideration.

Reviews.Title: Images not as sharp as other cameras
Reviews.Author: M. Klafehn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on reviews by other purchasers. However, I have found that the images are lacking in sharpness and contrast. Especially compared to the Sony camera (DSC-W530). It's low light capability is not as good as the Sony's mainly because the minimum f-stop is 3.1, while the Sony is 2.7. The camera is easy to use and the optical zoom is a nice feature, but for me, it all comes down to image sharpness. The other annoying fact is they don't include a stand alone battery charger. You must plug a USB cable into the camera, then the other end into an adapter, then plug the adapter in a wall outlet. 3rd party manf, make a stand alone charger, but this should be included in the package.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and value for money
Reviews.Author: Roger Clark
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera and great value for money. I've been taking photos for years and started with film cameras in the 1960s. And they were good cameras - Rolleiflexes, Leicas and Olympus OMs. In recent years I've used a number of these tiny Panasonic cameras and this is the best yet. The Leica lens is a dream - razor sharp right to the edges. And the colours are gorgeous - beautiful saturated colours.To get the best results you must engage with the camera. This is easy to do as all the info required is available from the menus. For example, I find if I use the IA (Intelligent Auto) setting images come out too light. The bright tones - highlights - burn out. But there's a simple solution! Use the Normal Picture setting instead. Then click the exposure control and darken the image slightly. I normally set the exposure two notches down to -2/3EV and leave it there. The result - a full range of tones with no more burnt out highlights.Unlike film cameras there's a slight shutter delay as this digital camera focuses. You press the shutter button slightly, pause a moment while the camera locks onto the subject and focusses, then press the shutter fully to take the picture. So these tiny compacts are not so good if you're going to do a lot of action photography where split-second timing is vital. You need a DSLR - or its equivalent - for that. But for normal use the camera produces good results. That having been said if you set the camera to SCN (Scene Mode) and then click on the sports scene mode it'll cope with movement quite well.If you're going to take a lot of pictures at night and in very dark conditions then it might be better to buy a camera with a wider aperture lens. But think of the expense! But if you going to take pictures in brighter conditions this camera performs well. What I also like about the Lumix DMC-SZ1 is its tiny size. I'm no longer weighed down with a mass of equipment as I was in the old days. I can carry it with me all the time and seize images as and when they appear.Although beginners can use this as a point-and-shoot camera it's more sophisticated than that. A camera and lens maker with the reputation of Leica would never have teamed up with a firm that made mundane products. This Lumix is refined and intelligent and capable of producing higly quality professional photos. I'm using it, as I have previous models, for virtually all my work.You can judge for yourself how well this camera performs if you look at a slideshow I've put out on YouTube. I went along to Winter Wonderland in London's Hyde Park - a spectacular funfair and festival held over Christmas and New year. As it was winter the light level was low. And I took pictures after dark as well so I was really pushing this camera technically. I was very pleased with the results. The colours are vibrant and even in low light the results are acceptable. If you type my full name - Roger George Clark - into YouTube, plus the name of the video - "Winter Wonderland" - you will find the photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen E. Howell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before taking a trip out west. I was very pleased with the results. I took a lot of landscape, animal, and rock formation photos, and they came out very well. The camera does a good job of focusing quickly. Several shots were taking out of the side window while going 50 to 70 mph. I was surprised that the camera focused so well on the shots taken while driving. I haven't tried many close-up shots so can't really speak to that aspect of the camera. Overall I am very pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Jige
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived very quickly so no problems with shipping. As for the item itself, it is OK, has extra lag time in comparison to several other digital cameras I've had which can make it difficult to capture those candid moments with children or pets. Quality of pictures is nothing special, perhaps I need to play around with the settings a little more but on auto the pictures don't really come out too great. I noticed this when I compared the same picture taken from several different camera's at a friend's wedding (all taken under auto).

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera & value!
Reviews.Author: Denis Kutch
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Lumix...a replacement after I fell and broke the 1st...and it's a significant improvement over the 1st.  As an architect, I needed a simple, compact, and reliable digital camera to use in the field for many different purposes...progress pics, interiors, details, distant shots, etc.  The 1st did these well.  This one is far better!  Yes, I could use an SLR digital for higher quality, but that was not a goal for this camera.  Incidentally, the the resolution and color rendition both are excellent!It arrived a day ahead of the estimate...the warranty & 8G memory card came even earlier.  The only downside is that it comes w/ so many features, I'm still discovering what all I can do with it.  However. the instructions are written so you can begin doing basic shooting, and then learn other capabilities as needed.This is an excellent camera for anyone in construction, real estate, engineering, design, etc....at least from my perspective!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix SZ1
Reviews.Author: CJ "MazPharma"
Reviews.Content: Super camera, easy to operate; takes excellent quality pictures outdoors; indoors OK -- best with flash, although altering settings achieves good results. Sharp, excellent colour balance. Video quality excellent!Love the long battery life -- bought rechargeable as emergency spare; fast charge, ready to go.This camera replaces aging  6-year old Fujipix, which took the best pictures and was hard to beat. Panasonic has a competitive product that is more versatile and seems likely to match the Fujipix (didn't buy another Fujipix since the reviews were poor; what happened? this was a great 3 megapixel that delivered)Overall, the Panasonic Lumix SZ1 is great value for money; likely explains why I see so many around! For $30 I also bought the Lumix FH27, which is very similar to this camera with some extra features. Both models produce identical high quality pictures. Unless you need the other features (eg, more landscape settings) I'd go with the Lumix SZ1.

Reviews.Title: Ckingitout
Reviews.Author: CallieOops "Goldie Oldie"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera and even the zoom photos are terrific! I took a photo of a bluebird on a feeder and it is amazing even taken through a window. Still working through all that the camera is capable of but I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera x2
Reviews.Author: kimwood "music fan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras -- the first one was a birthday gift for my BF prior to a trip to London and Ireland. The compact size, zoom features, and Panasonic quality made it especially appealing.  The on-screen descriptions are very helpful.  Outdoor landscape shots are beautiful.  The burst mode (10 frames per second) turned out to be a fantastic option for taking photos of the Olympic road race cyclists as they zoomed by.  The panoramic feature is so cool too.....you just pan across while it captures the image. No stitching required.  The first time he panned too slowly and the on-screen instructions popped up saying to move faster.  The printed images look great.  Having a separate button for video is convenient too.Based on an earlier reviewer's post, I also purchased the aftermarket Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Panasonic DMW-BCK7, NCA-YN101G, DE-A91, DE-A92 and Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH2, DMC-FH4, DMC-FH5, DMC-FH6, DMC-FH7, DMC-FH8, DMC-FH25, DMC-FH27, DMC-FP5, DMC-FP7, DMC-FS16, DMC-FS18, DMC-FS22, DMC-FS28, DMC-FS35, DMC.... Having two spare batteries already charged up was perfect for sightseeing days. I also like having the ability to able to charge the batteries externally.Then one day, when amazon dropped the price by twenty more dollars, I bought myself a second camera. It is for Girl Scout troop activities as well as times when my Canon G11 is more than I want to carry around. The Canon, of course, has more features (that I'm still learning after three years) and does take the better shots in low light settings.I highly recommend this Panasonic camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: gdad
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera based on a recommendation about the quality of the lens, and I liked its compact size and ease of operation as I was looking for something easy to carry and use on our European vacation. It far exceeded our expectations and everyone who has viewed our pictures raved about them.

Reviews.Title: Fab cam ! Best in its price range
Reviews.Author: Swan
Reviews.Content: I already have D3100 and D7000 but wanted something lightweight and small. After a lengthy homework finally picked this cam and wasn't surprised by its quality snaps at all! It may not have those fancy cool features that some of the other competitor's have but it does what it is meant for, take awesome snaps ! Simple. Best in its price range.Delivery was good, before time as usual by J&R; with best price out there.I would  recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: The HD quality is brilliant
Reviews.Author: Willis "joey4649"
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with this, even when it's not that steady it takes great high quality pictures and the video it can produce is great.  Audio clarity on video is also great, much better than our last camera.  I was particularly impressed with how well it coped with recording sound and video in a noisy party environment.  Certainly far superior to our last camera.

Reviews.Title: Even my wife can use it.
Reviews.Author: D. Pepe
Reviews.Content: She is a very accomplished woman but, by her own admission, devices are not her forte. It is my duty to shield her. She wanted to upgrade from her phone camera for her next Italy trip. I researched to find a model with good image quality and features (image stabilization was essential) that also rated very highly on ease of use. This one seemed to stand out in those regards and was not all that expensive comparatively. Her trip is over and the verdict is in, "I love that little camera." says she.Almost 800 pictures and almost no blurry ones--a remarkable feat. I will probably use it myself when I next have use for a pocket camera. I don't know how well it will hold up over time, but as of now it has passed the test.

Reviews.Title: So many excellent features
Reviews.Author: Alice Tolkland "gadget grannie"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to get a good compact point & shoot and this camera gets high marks in it's price range.The phd settings are great (push here dummy) and deliver a very good quality image exactly as selected.The zoom leaves me a little cold, even though other reviewers are more positive about the feature.  I do have to work with it more but it seems 'loose' in maintaining focus in the LCD, though the pictures do come out just fine - a tripod is definitely needed for higher zoom levels.The Leica lens was a selling point for me as I am an artist and use this camera to digitize my paintings for prints. The 16.1 MP with my art on the easel and a tripod, give an excellent image to work with. I used a 3.1 MP Olympus for years and had to sharpen and adjust quite a bit. Even though this is a P&S; camera and, ideally I'm told, art images should be shot with an expensive SLR, I've had no such adjustment issues, no consumer issues with the prints and have even had a few excellent gicleés produced.The solid performance of the macro/macro zoom feature is especially appreciated as many of my 'subjects' are floral close-ups.There's a lot to learn to use this camera's features perfectly but for travel and general use it's easy and small, with a good sized LCD - an ideal P&S; for sure.Upate: Took some stunning pictures during a recent visit to Italy. Even without flash in museums [where allowed, of course ;)] the images are amazingly sharp and bright using the 'intelligent' ISO - often in areas with very little light and often without remembering to turn the flash back on when I could! Cannot be more pleased with this camera. Panasonic Lumix SZ1 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jill Smith (Arizona)
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for our 9 year old daughter as a first "real" camera.  The price is low enough we figured it would be decent but not fabulous.  We were wrong, this camera is better than the one I use!  It has a clear screen and awesome zoom.  Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Silvina
Reviews.Content: This camera has a very beauty design and the sizes are perfect!. I don't try all your services yet, but I could start using it easily, the main commands are very simple. The images are very well, I think is perfect as a camera for non proffesionals. Sorry about my English, bye from Argentina!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Z.
Reviews.Content: This little camera did a great job. I especially appreciated the its abilty to take low-light pictures. We were in a lot of churches on my trip and the photos all came out clear and bright (unless there was a shadow). Our previous camera, Canon Powershot A720iS, didn't do so well in Italy 2 yrs ago: most of those church pix are blurry.Only once or twice did I use up both batteries during the day. Then, it was tricky to charge them both - I got up in the middle of the night to switch them in the camera, since it takes about 3 hrs to recharge one and it only charges while in the camera.

Reviews.Title: Far exceeded expectations!
Reviews.Author: alene
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a very specific purpose.  (I do have other "fancier" cameras that I use for more serious photography.)I didn't really expect much from this tiny (but pretty) little thing.  I was stunned when I saw the quality of the first sample shots I took with it.  They were sharp, the colors were stunningly rich and the focus was right on target, even though it doesn't have a spot focusing option.If I were to have one complaint it would be that the camera does not come with its own separate wall charger.  It has one that you can use with the battery still in the camera, but that isn't practical for the way I use cameras.  So I ordered the Wasabi unit with two extra batteries to go with the SZ1 and together they make a perfectly usable piece of equipment that I expect will get far more use than I originally intended.I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, slightly weak flash
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Landman
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pictures, is very easy to use and is a fabulous bargain. I would have given it 5 stars but the flash is a little underpowered. Fine for close shots but not enough for big groups or longer shots.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix SZ1 Performs Beautifully
Reviews.Author: Art Hall
Reviews.Content: This highly-rated point-and-shoot digital camera did everything the reviews said and more!  It performed extremely well from the get-go on a trip to the Middle East, capturing all of the memories we hoped to bring back.  The only poor shots were due to operator error, since the camera arrived only about two days before our departure and this operator didn't have time to read all of the 128-page manual that comes on an included CD.  Our only complaint is that it is hard to frame shots on the LCD screen in bright sunlight.  Our older digital has both a viewfinder and the LCD option and handling a blinding sun is no problem.  We highly recommend this camera for all but the professional or near-professional photographer..

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: Momof3Boys
Reviews.Content: I ordered this based on other reviews -basically took a gamble-- and it paid off!  The camera is super, super easy to use.  I set it on intelligent auto and it truly does quickly sense what it has to do. There is no delay with photos- most of my pictures are of moving kids and it focuses really fast and lets you take multiple photos without waiting for the picture to be written to the card.  The 10X zoom is very clear- much better than I expected.  I swore I'd never buy another camera without AA batteries and this one does take a special battery, but I was able to buy a spare for around $8. Overall, I am thrilled- plus it is small enough to fit in a pocket or purse. Great buy for a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tammy McDonald
Reviews.Content: My only complaint about this camera is that the battery charges in the camera. I wish I could take the battery out to charge and have an extra battery to use in the meantime.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!!! :)
Reviews.Author: kessi
Reviews.Content: It's the best camera I had!!!When you take a picture there not bright or dark, you can take pictures from a far distance!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Two Wheels "Ventana"
Reviews.Content: Camera is very small and light, easy to carry in a pocket. Operation is simple, focusing and processing are fast. After a week of use I've been able to get many good photos outside and inside. Good macro. Great panorama shots. 720p movies are clear. Zoom is quick and optical stabilization works very well. Unless you plan to make large prints this one takes sharp pictures. For less than $100 this is a steal.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: G. Lee
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera about two months now and I must say that I am very impressed that a camera at this low price could have so many features and could take such rich pictures and videos. The only minor issue I have with this camera is  taking clear pictures of moving objects in dim light. I am still experimenting with the features to accomplish this but I wouldn't sweat over it. At this price for this gem, it is a steal of a deal. I particularly love the fact that when I am shooting videos, objects that I zoom into stay in focus and there is no recording of the zooming in audio; very professional. Great service again Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the videos
Reviews.Author: A Nurd
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the videos this pocket point-n-shot camera produces. This is the first pocket camera I've owned that lets you zoom when recording video. That's nice. I'm happy with the time the battery holds a charge. Still images are a nice quality. The optical zoom is great. The only thing I don't like is the toggle on/off switch. I abuse pocket cameras and I'm guessing the switch will be the first thing to break. We'll see.

Reviews.Title: CAUTION!
Reviews.Author: Brydon Baker
Reviews.Content: I really was happy when I got this camera in a deal that included an SD card and case.  I loved the zoom and wide angle. THEN IT HAPPENED.  There was dust, lots of dust, on the lens.  So I tried to get it off, except it's INSIDE THE CAMERA.  This lens, when zoomed, sticks out about 2" with three segments.  I guess dust landed on the extended section and was sucked back inside where it now is a permanent part of EVERY SINGLE PICTURE.  Several camera stores later, and the same story: it'll cost more to de-dust it than to replace it.  And it was always in its case, not stuffed in a dirty bag.  I've owned many different kinds/brands of digital cameras, and this is the first one to do this.  Can't recommend this one. BTW, if anyone knows a magic way to get the dust off, let me know!  I've tried everything, including high pressure clean nitrogen from a movie camera darkroom.  To no avail.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: Heft
Reviews.Content: One of the best cameras on the market today. I would buy this model camera again and again. I loved my old LUMIX and still do but this takes far better pictures than my old bullet-proof camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Jon C. Lundell "Jon C Lundell"
Reviews.Content: Fast compact thorough and priced right. Panasonic Lumix is top shelf and at this point I would buy no other brand.

Reviews.Title: lightweight, excellent handling, great pictures
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: I replaced a Canon Powershot, a far inferior camera. The Lumix' battery charges within an hour and lasts a long time, longer than the estimate in Consumer Reports. It's easy to use and has the usual features for a camera in this price/quality range. Good handling balance.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good...
Reviews.Author: Treblemaker
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few weeks now and so far I like it.  The zoom seems to work well and is sufficient for my needs.  I need to work with the settings to get the pictures to come out correctly but that is just a learning curve for me.  I replaced an older Lumix with this camera and love the Lumix line in general. The size is great, the screen is awesome and the controls are fairly user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Sharp detail, great zoom range, easy to use
Reviews.Author: W. Gates "Tennessee Teacher"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift to my wife's stepdaughter.  She absolutely loves it -- convenient pocket size, sharp detail, easy to operate, easy uploads.  With the sharpness of the photos and the 10x zoom, it would be difficult to find another camera at a more reasonable price.  This is the second purchase of a similar Panasonic Lumix.  Great line . . . .

Reviews.Title: new camera is a hit so far
Reviews.Author: L. Vizer "Music Nut"
Reviews.Content: The quick instructions were intelligent and easy to follow, so that it was easy to be up and running in the first sitting. (The clear writing of manuals is an art form.) So far I am delighted with the camera''s performance. When I am more proficient with the more customized settings I will be able to evaluate the camera in more detail.I like the size of it and the fit in my hand, and the light weight of it in my handbag.Just by skimming the manual online, I am amazed at what this little baby can do. i've got my homework cut out for me.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Coult
Reviews.Content: I bought the SZ1 as a gift,  I have a ZS20 with similar features that cost almost twice what the SZ1 does.  The only noticeable differences are that the more expensive camera has an internal GPS and a longer optical zoom.  The camera take great shots especially using the panorama feature.  The quality of the photos equals that of many expensive point-and-shoot units.  I am very pleased with the camera and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Deisy Liliana Tellez Marin
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my camera, although it doesn't work perfectly in dark places. Maybe I need to learn better about the functions.In my opinion the rest was as described.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix SZ1
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased w/my purchase of the Panasonic Lumix SZ1 MP Digital Camera.  I have owned a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ50, for many years and am very pleased w/it.  However, I have been looking for a smaller, light weight digital w/an optical zoom.  I did research many other small digitals before making my decision.  I am so happy w/the Lumix SZ1.  Since I was familar w/the workings of the Lumix I was very happy to see that many of the same features are featured in this new Lumix.Great camera that takes great shots, easy to use, light weight, w/many great features.  Well worth the money. Honestly, I think this camera is a steal for the price listed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: adventurer
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent as a substitute for my DSLR when I do not want to carry the bigger, bulkier SLR. The picture setup options are quite intuitive or else I can just use the auto settings with good success as well.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-SZ1
Reviews.Author: mbztony
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace a Cannon point and shoot that was just too slow to focus. I only had the Cannon for about 6 months and my impatience with its slow speed got the best of me. So far I am very impressed with this DMC-SZ1.  I have been an advanced level amateur photographer for many years.  I own several camera's including 35mm SLR's, pro-sumer level Nikon DSLR's, and a Nikon D7100 pro-sumer level point and shoot.  I like to have something compact to carry all the time and my other camera's are too bulky for that.  I wanted a budget minded everyday camera that would produce impressive results and focus quickly so I wouldn't miss any photo opps!  This Panasonic has produced impressive photo's for it's price range, great white balance, reasonably effective short range flash, and from power on to focus and shoot it is impressively fast.  The 16 mega-pixel sensor combined with the Leica sourced lens all work well together and the photos captured have more than impressed me for a camera in this price range.  Highly recommend this camera for everyday use!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Denver H. A. Walker
Reviews.Content: Have only been using it for a couple of days, but this camera seems the perfect combination of sophistication and ease-of-use.  Love the zoom!

Reviews.Title: Broke after 3 uses
Reviews.Author: Lauren Colizza
Reviews.Content: Camera ordered in Oct 2013, used 3 times during over the holidays before it broke. Because it was longer than 30 days before it broke, Amazon advised me to go through the manufacturer for the repairs. Followed the manufacturers instructions and sent camera to repair center in January 2014.  Today is May 9th, and the camera is still not returned to me. Because the camera needed to pass through so many hands, everyone is denying responsibility for the product. Apparently the Amazon guarantee only applies when the item is directly purchased through Amazon and they have no responsibility or standards for their sellers to uphold. A $160.00 camera breaking after 3 uses is unacceptable when purchased in "new" condition. Moral of the story: buy your electronics at an actual store where you can return it in person.

Reviews.Title: Missing parts...older model
Reviews.Author: D. N. Pritchett Jr.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace one that I had ordered a few months ago, but had a lens problem when dropped in the sand.  The one I received this time was an older model than the last one, had missing parts and might have been used before.  Big disappointment.  I returned it and the only positive thing I can say is that Amazon truly makes returns easy.  Will buy from Amazon always, but probably not this camera model again.

Reviews.Title: warrenty beware!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Barbeau
Reviews.Content: this camera broke after 2 months, lens error, I returned it under full warranty in august 2013, since then it has gone back three times.  I sent in a DMC-SZ1 and they keep sending me a DMC-SZ3, when I talk to the service center I am assured there is no problem sending me the camera I purchased.  The replacement unit they sent is also only refurbished with a 90 day warranty.  I am trying one more time then am done forever with Panasonic, pathetic! here is it April 2014 and just got the wrong camera for the fourth time!

Reviews.Title: Broke after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Shasta
Reviews.Content: Zoom lens failed after 6 months and only the second time I used it. Returned to panasonic in July for repair/replacement. Since I live in the same city as their repair center, I hand delivered it directly to the center. I had to wait over 2 hours because no one there knew how to accept a device that wasn't shipped to the center.I didn't receive a replacement until October!!!!! They replaced it with a different model that was also broken. As soon as I turned it on, the zoom lens stuck half way open and failed to work. I attempted to contact panasonic and their computerized system hung up on me repeatedly. I got frustrated and stuck it in a drawer. Today I spent the past 4 hours trying to get panasonic to work with me. They expect me to repeat the same process as I went through in July for yet another camera. I am now working with squaretrade warranty to have it refunded.I am done with panasonic!!!! Worst customer service and products on the market.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: laundry woman
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to replace an Olympic camera that finally had its last day.  This camera is easy to use and operate.

Reviews.Title: Dusty dusty dusty
Reviews.Author: Maggie P.
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera at first.  Easy point and shoot, could often get decent pictures of my squirmy 3 month old, held its charge, etc...  But after a month a spot of dust got inside the lens.  No big deal, right?  Just move the camera off-center and no one will notice.  Then the spot moved closer to the center.  Then a second spot appeared.  I tried using a can of air, gently knocking the camera, turning it on and off, etc..  Nothing worked.  Now I'm irritated.  I searched online and found a video that explained that this brand (not sure if it happens to other cameras or not) sucks dust in when you turn it on.  I now had two choices.  Either try to fix the camera myself or buy a new one.  I chose the former since I don't have the money right now to buy another.  I took the camera apart using a size 0 screwdriver and was able to get the dust off of the lens.  Please be aware that my camera no longer works as well (entirely my fault for taking it apart!) so keep that in mind if this happens to you.  It is possible to clean, but you will risk messing up your camera permanently.UPDATE 5/12/14I've continued using this camera simply because I don't have the funds to purchase a new one at this time (and when I do, it will most certainly NOT be another Panasonic lumix!).  Since posting the first review, I can only get the camera to focus properly about 50% of the time, if I'm lucky. I'm sure this is because I took it apart to clean it.  More dust spots have appeared but I'm trying to ignore them as long as possible.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: Senem
Reviews.Content: This is the last Panasonic I will be buying. I had a Lumix before this one, it was OK and after 2 years its zoom function broke. Loving the color and because I was used to the interface (it must have been) I bought this one. The picture quality is never right. I am not an expert, but I am reasonably proficient with gadgets… I should be able to produce good shots with a digital camera that has an automatic function. Why did I buy the same brand after I had one that broke in two years?

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: jy
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could carry in my purse so that I am never in the "I wish I had my camera" situation.  Although this camera is small and light weight and fits in my handbag, I am unhappy with the picture quality.  Believe it or not, in many cases I can actually get better pictures with my Ipad mini so that's saying a LOT.  I cannot recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying new camera
Reviews.Author: Franna
Reviews.Content: I do like my camera. Have not had a new digital for about eight years and decided to upgrade. I am still learning about all the features, but it is easy to operate and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Susan Foreman
Reviews.Content: So far I am very please with this camera. It takes great indoor and outdoor pictures; in low light and bright sunlight; close-up and far away. Pictures taken with the zoom are clear and crisp. I would recommend this camera without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great Value with this camera
Reviews.Author: Terrence M. Gaul
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a less bulky option than my Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35 for a recent trip and this camera was an excellent choice. Great features for the low price.  A little degradation at high zoom (compared to the FZ35) but otherwise takes tremendous pictures with all the options you would expect for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nice pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera works well and takes exceptional pictures. It is smart phone size so it fits in a shirt pocket. Wish it had a regular viewfinder or  brighter screen as it is hard to find your shot in bright sunlight if you are wearing dark glasses.

Reviews.Title: Happy with operation and quality
Reviews.Author: Jim Martin
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the auto focus and exposure, great results.  Easy to use.Only minor complaint is that you have to use a lot of ink to print out the instruction manual.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Luna
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take pictures of fast moving kids in the classroom, close-up shots of flowers and small critters, and the typical travel photos.  It's my first digital camera so I can't compare it to others, but I can say that it's very easy to figure out right out of the box, starts up quickly, takes decent videos, and doesn't need to be recharged frequently.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic DMC SZ1 for work.  Having to take detailed photos it stood to reason we purchased a camera in the class of ones we've purchased in the past.It's quick to set up, from picture size to formatting the SD card.  It took longer to thread the lanyard in than it did to set up the camera to take it's first photos.The display on the back of the camera is generous in size.  IF you use the I.A. feature you can get incredibly detailed photos of minute items.The only draw back with this camera in my opinion is the battery.  While it lasts for a long time on a charge, in the past our Panasonic cameras have come with a wall mount charger that we just dropped our battery in.  This unit only comes with a fly wire and plug in adapter.Would I buy it again you ask?Yes!  I'd like to buy several more for our various departments.Happy Picture taking!

Reviews.Title: Had to return it
Reviews.Author: Laura J. Wellner
Reviews.Content: This is my second Panasonic, I loved the camera first one and used it for about a year before dark spots started to appear in my photos. This new one also developed two spots that show up in the center of the screen and my photos, I sent it right back. It's disappointing to have the same problem, I've barely had it out of the box for a week. Too bad, it was a nice little camera for a point n' shoot little guy, not as well made (not as solid feeling as the first one) I was quite pleased with it until these spots appeared.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: V. Marrone
Reviews.Content: Compact size with a large 3 " screen along with good looks, a Leica lens and crisp, clear photos , a 10x zoom, makes for a really good buy. Significantly better shots than my Canon  Elph 450. No negatives so far except for a voluminous  instruction download manual.

Reviews.Title: Tiny Gem
Reviews.Author: meow20
Reviews.Content: The weight is the only thing that is light on this camera.  For a small camera, it packs a big punch!!  The photos are awesome the zoom lens rivals it bigger, over-sized counterparts.  Well worth the money.  Don't be put off by the manufacturer.  This is a must have!!!

Reviews.Title: Auto Focus
Reviews.Author: mendo walker
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could pull out and take good pictures without thinking about it. This camera has been great.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: daddy's girl
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I need the stabilizer to take clear pictures. The stabilizer really works. This is my second Panasonic Lumix. I got this one because I wanted more zoom. The camera is easy to use, easy to carry (fits in a pocket), and takes clear pictures. My kids got me a Nikon with a big zoom but without the stabilizer the pictures were  not clear. The Nikon was not user friendly. I primarily use my camera for travel photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a gift for my mom for her birthday. She's been looking for a smaller camera with better quality than her old Kodak. This had great reviews and was only $130 so I bought it. She loves it! All the features are great, although sometimes hard to navigate. It takes a while to get used to as with any new device. Beautiful straight out of the package and arrived before scheduled. The picture quality is absolutely amazing. The panorama is really cool too. Overall this camera gets an A+

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: LynnD
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the quality and clarity that this camera produces. At 16 megapixels I can't imagine needing anymore camera strength than this. It also has a 10x zoom that is smooth to operate as well. I love the fact that it came with a rechargable battery with it's own battery charger. I take nice clear, crisp pictures and even the low lighting places seem to take nice pictures as well. I had the exact camera but in a 14 Megapaxil rating, and I gave it away to a dear friend of mine who was not camera savy. Once I showed it to her she was very impressed at my expensive (So she thought!) gift to her. I had only paid $69.00 for my first one and I loved it so much that I had to go out and buy the higher pixel rating knowing that if 14 took such good pictures I was super confident that the 16 megapixel would be even better.  I simply love this camera and am proud to have given my friend the camera that I did, as well as owning my new one also. Panasonic is so easy to use that I prefer it over most other higher end cameras of this class any day of the week! LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Acejewell
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera for the money. I own two now. One for me and one for the wife. Good buy.

Reviews.Title: dummy proof
Reviews.Author: casey lance pittman
Reviews.Content: Turn it on. Take pictures. Low focus time, no confusing gadgets, good battery life. Can't go wrong for the price.

Reviews.Title: winner
Reviews.Author: L. Bankerd
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my adultdaughter.  I chose it based on reccomendations from Consumer Reports.  She is very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Alicia Cluff
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert on cameras but this one is easy to operate and does a good job on the pictures.  Even figured out the movie camera part.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but VERY prone to dust particles.
Reviews.Author: patkottcamp
Reviews.Content: I had been told that Panasonic Lumix was a very good brand, it is indeed except one (not so small) point which needs to be pointed out. Now i live in the very dusty environment of southern Utah, it is also a very photographic environment, hence the "rub". I tend to take the camera out very much. Well apparently it is not well sealed because within three weeks of purchase it was so full of dust particles/dirt/sand as to be almost unusable. I took it apart and cleaned it, tedious project and it seems to work but there are still particles in there. I am VERY disappointed in this aspect of the camera and would try another brand because of it, perhaps waterproof would be better due to seals? I now carry it in a plastic baggy, let the buyer beware!  Still the quality of it's images is unassailable.

Reviews.Title: Useful and handy pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recently took this little camera on a trip to Italy and Morocco and found it to be a reliable picture taker with good,  but not excellent,  picture quality.  Images can be a little soft when printed out larger than 4" by 6".On the other hand,  the camera is terrifically convenient,  and it fits in a shirt pocket.  I found it to be especially useful in North Africa,  where people can be a little camera shy.  This one is small and discreet, and often went unnoticed. That was a big plus for me.If convenience is very important to you, I can recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Basic Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: For a high quality basic point and shoot this is it... I compared it to several others and based off of other reviews chose this one and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Clear and colorful pictures with a great zoom
Reviews.Author: Janet Landers
Reviews.Content: I chose the 4 star rating because I am not techology savvy and am finding it hard to work through the instructions. I've still not master replaying the videos. I've installed The PhotofunStudio, but it is not working properly. But the camera takes wonderful pictures and is easy to zoom and change from portrait to scenic etc. I like it.

Reviews.Title: A great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Curtis T Olden
Reviews.Content: I needed a point and shoot pocket camera to go with my SLR.  My mom bought an earlier model Lumix, and liked it, so I figured I'd try this out.  The verdict: great for a point and shoot, but there are fewer features on this model than I have seen on other, small cameras.  I put it through a range of settings and light levels, and the performance is what I expect from a higher-end pocket camera.  I like the ease of use, and the fast flash-to-flash response.  The LCD is large and crisp.  I don't much care for the D-pad style control.  It's all chromed, making it very hard to see in low light. All told, excellent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very happy!
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Easy to navigate menus and easy to download photos to the computer.  Resolution could be a little better, but overall I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good quality for the size
Reviews.Author: R. Beckley "bobb"
Reviews.Content: I have a couple other Lumix digital cameras, but they are larger and heavier so I don't always carry them around.  I wanted a camera that was lighter but still took good pictures and had a decent optical zoom.  This camera is a good mix of those capabilities, and I light the blue color.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera! Better than my Canon.
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon digital camera that was taking fuzzy pictures. I got tired of that so I got this a few months ago and not one picture comes out bad. Great quality! No fuzzy/blurry pictures. Very happy about this purchase!

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: fmc
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for christmas and she is in love with it. We have been borrowing a digital compact camera from her best friend on prior trips and I really hated that Olympus. This camera is very easy to use, quick to start up, quick to recycle for next shot, gives fine pictures, and has multiple modes for exposure and focus to allow real creativity in picture taking. Its also light and comfortable to use. I cant report on lcd viewer performance in the sun.The battery is user replaceable and I've found replacements at low cost, so you can have a spare battery if you need it. Battery recharge is via USB connector so many options for charging exist also.The camera comes with software for organizing photos, but that is not necessary to use the camera and download pictures as far as I can tell.I've seen plenty of nice cameras cheaper but this still looks like a really good deal to me.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Alyce Pace Forlani
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, compact and lightweight.  It takes nice, clear pictures.  The controls are easy to use so that even an amateur like me can take great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Perfect conditions
Reviews.Author: Andri Pedro Viegas Cabral Gongalves
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time, safe and in perfect conditions. Just as I was expecting. No more, no less. I'm very happy :)

Reviews.Title: Pocket perfect
Reviews.Author: LaVon Baker
Reviews.Content: Takes excellent pictures and crop clear when editing.  Love the lens! Battery life is excellent Recommend this little camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix SZ1 16.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: GNL
Reviews.Content: Good Price Fast Delivery!  This is an ok camera.  Has decent functions and take ok photos.  Tends to get lint or dirt in the lens which creates dark spots in photos.  Still working on an easy inexpensive resolution.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera! I had a Panasonic Lumix from 2007 and bought this is a replacement in summer 2012. It's great! I love the slim design, picture quality, different camera settings, and the improved night time picture taking quality. There's even a mode for taking photos through glass, which works quite well in museums. Excellent camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Simmons
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good camera.  Some of the flaps (doors for the USB cable, memory card and baterry are a bit flimsy.  However, it is easy to use and takes great pictures.  Would serve a non-camera expert well.

Reviews.Title: great camera, better than expected
Reviews.Author: A. Frank
Reviews.Content: love the features on the camera.  Video quite good, even in lower lighting.  Very nice feature of autocorrecting image right in the camera settings.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I looked at many others but decided on this one and I'm so glad I did!

Reviews.Title: totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Fiorella Taboada
Reviews.Content: its a great camera, very light, good for travels, good zoom and great pictures, the battery also gives you lots of time

Reviews.Title: really happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: denise
Reviews.Content: we bought this as a replacement for a kodak we had for years.  this one has a lot more options and makes graeat pictures and video.  i'm so glad i didn't go for a more expensive or other brand model as this one does all we wanted and more!

Reviews.Title: Takes amazing pictures! Every traveler should have one.
Reviews.Author: Sherridan
Reviews.Content: The pictures are sharp and great, the Zoom just as good. The best small camera for traveling.It is easy to setup and use.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use camera! I would recommend this for anyone who needs a no-fuss camera which you can use quickly without worry. It also has an awesome flash that takes great night shots!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Lam "cyberman"
Reviews.Content: This is my third lumix camera because I love their wide angle lenses and beautiful picture taking capabilities.  The camera starts up fairly quickly and takes very nice quality pictures.  I like the panoramic mode and other special settings.  The camera is light and small so I can bring it along everywhere I go.  The video mode is also very good and records in hi def  mode.  I bought an extra battery from wasabi power. i highly recommend this camera .  I had it for almost a year already.  It has 16 mp so use a larger memory card.  I use a 16 gb sd card and it works perfect for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrea M. Stahl "Andrea"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have tried several point and shoot cameras in the past year and this was the best by far. Great zoom, clear pics. Excellent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: All I Wanted !
Reviews.Author: penut420
Reviews.Content: After dealing with Kodak Easyshare problems for a few years (I won't go into how terrible my experience was with that camera!), I decided it was time for a different camera. My business requires me to take numerous close-up photos, and the old camera was terrible for that! So far, this Panasonic is a dream come true. After taking several test photos with different cameras in a local department store, I was happily suprised at how CLEAR these images were...so, I spontaneously purchased it. So far, it's doing everything I need it to do. My tasks are SOOOO much easier and faster with this camera! It really does take fantastic photos. I am no photographer, but my eyesight is good, and when a photo is clear it is CLEAR. These photos are clear.Aside from that, it's lightweight and fairly easy to use. I highly recommend this camera for anyone who simply wants to take easy, CLEAR pictures. No fuss! No stress! Just click.However, I've only had the camera for a week, but if anything changes I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this after reading other positive reviews. The camera takes good pictures and the 10x optical zoom really comes in handy. The LCD screen is large making it easy to look at pictures you've already taken. I have not had chance to play with all of the features but right out of the box it takes good pictures with the auto settings for the most part. There were a couple of instances when the flash fired when it was on automatic when it wasn't really needed and made the pictures too bright. It was easy though to turn off the flash and take the pictures again. The only concern about the camera that I have is the little plastic door where the USB cable plugs in. It seems pretty flimsy and I feel it will eventually break off. Other than that it is a great camera especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Rathbone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly for carrying with me when hiking, walking etc.  I have larger Panasonic Lumix camera which I really like, but it is a bit big to carry when hiking.  This camera takes great pictures and I have no complaints about it.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix is very small and light and its so easy to carry in my purse.  So far I've enjoyed the pictures I've taken with it.  I've filmed a lot of video too and they videos are so clear.  I highly recommend this camera if you're looking for a point and shoot that you can easily carry in your purse.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Nidia Blanco
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful camera, the zoom and the quality of the photos are perfect. Just what I need. I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Great price!
Reviews.Author: Oriana
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with my purchase. At first I couldn't believe the price, it's a good deal, I think. I also thought that for the price I was getting a AA battery powered camera, but no, so great! I looooove this camera...

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: J. Emmerthal
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a lost camera and I love the pitcture clarity as well as the zoom. It brings everything right up close. I find it easy to use once you read the intructions to change settings around.

Reviews.Title: Everything I need and more
Reviews.Author: Octopedaler
Reviews.Content: This was a Consumers Reports Best Buy for a "point and shoot' camera, which is why I bought it. It has dozens of advanced features which I did not need, and I was afraid these might make the camera too complicated to use. Happily, if you don't mess with the default settings, it is a very easy-to-use point & shoot camera, including ready access to the optical zoom function. My rating applies only to the basic camera functions, including zoom, as I have not tested the video, burst mode, or other advanced features.

Reviews.Title: New to Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Clarisa L. Woodruff
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to admit that I've been a lifelong Canon girl....from my first film camera, all the way through several generations to my just recently "misplaced" and much (MUCH) loved digital.  However, Canon tends to be at the more expensive end of the camera price spectrum (I always could pick the most expensive option) and I'm currently planning my DSLR purchase so I opted for a <$100 price range for this purchase.  That being said, I do quite love this camera.  No, I don't appreciate the toy-looking display or the color quality for photo review, but the diversity of shooting options are better than I expected, the actual color quality is fantastic when on my Mac or printed out, and the machine gun speed panorama shooting option is pretty phenominal.....preferable to any other on-board option I've used to date.....and the color is beautiful, won't get lost in the woods if I drop it either :)

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: If your looking to be a professional photographer this is not going to get it.  I use it to take pictures for eBay and it works great

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Schley
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Panasonic Lumix TZ5 at work and wanted a similar camera for home. The SZ1 has a smaller body than the TZ5 which I like because it weighs less, but it does make one-handed operation a little more of a challenge for me. Great for close up pics and has the 10x optical zoom that I use all the time. The only thing I'm not fond of is the battery does not charge separately from the camera.  The battery needs to be in the camera and then the camera plugged for the battery to charge.  This means I can't replace the dead battery with a second fully charged one and keep taking pics while I recharge the dead battery in a separate charger. Not a huge issue, but I do miss having the separate charger.  Overall it's a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recently took this camera with me on a vacation and it performed well. It has easy to set options for the iso etc. for people that like to manually adjust those, as well as auto features for people who don't. The battery life has been great so far, I took over 100 pictures and it still showed 3/3 bars of battery life left.It has good feel in your hands, not the greatest grip but there is a large, flat front where your fingers won't block the lens. The only real gripe I have is with the wrist strap - It's cheap! I used the wrist strap from my old camera instead, but so you may want to find a replacement.Overall it's a pretty nice camera. It takes good photos, is light/easy to carry, and has good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Soft, Soft, Shots
Reviews.Author: J. E. Belschner
Reviews.Content: I use point and shoots on a daily basis for work, and I thought I was getting a good camera from panasonic but the shots were soft. I have a earlier model lumix and I loved it but this model was quite a disappointment. Its tough to shop for digi cameras online cause you can only go by reputations but hopefully this reviews helps you to make a wise decision.

Reviews.Title: noisy and out of focus
Reviews.Author: sword
